title: 113_s2180
content: The Act may be cited as the "Support Theaters in America Growth and Expansion Act" or the "STAGE Act". It includes provisions for the expensing of qualified productions. The "Support Theaters in America Growth and Expansion Act" or the "STAGE Act" extends the expensing provisions for qualified productions until December 31, 2015. It also includes provisions for live theatrical productions. The "STAGE Act" extends expensing provisions for qualified productions until December 31, 2015, including live theatrical productions. Section 181 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to define a "qualified live theatrical production" as one where 75% of total compensation is qualified. The paragraph describes a live staged production of a play derived from a written book or script, produced by a commercial entity in a venue with an audience capacity of not more than 3,000. It also includes provisions for touring companies with separate phases. The paragraph outlines that each live staged production of a play, including separate phases or simultaneous stagings in different locations, should be treated as a separate production. It also excludes productions involving certain types of performances as defined by law. The amendments made by this section apply to live theatrical productions starting after December 31, 2013. The date of commencement for a qualified live theatrical production is the first public performance for a paying audience. SEC. 3. DISPOSITIONS OF INTEREST IN THEATRICAL PRODUCTIONS AS PASSIVE ACTIVITY. The amendment to section 469 of the Internal Revenue Code introduces a special rule for interests in qualified live theatrical productions, treating each phase of the production separately for passive activity purposes. The termination of any phase in which the taxpayer has a passive interest is considered a disposition of the entire interest in the activity. The amendment to section 469 of the Internal Revenue Code introduces a special rule for interests in qualified live theatrical productions, treating each phase of the production separately for passive activity purposes. This includes the initial staging, subsequent stagings or touring, and the disposition of copyrights or licensing rights. The amendment made by this section applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2013.
